election_record.label: Pennsylvania 1805 State Senate, District 12

overview.note: Numerous sources report only three candidates in this election and that Henry Wertz had the highest vote total. However, the United States' Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) from October 26, 1805 explains that: "Two of the judges gave it as their opinion, that the votes given for Henry Wertz, junior, and those for Henry Wertz, were all intended for Henry Wertz, junior; and therefore, in making out the return, they did not declare who was chosen, but left the determination to the senate. As there are actually two persons of that name in the district, a father and a son, there can be no doubt the senate must decide that both were voted for. Consequently, Mr. Morrison, a constitutionalist of high respectability, may be considered as elected, and will doubtless be declared entitled to the seat."

"In casting up the votes, it appeared that Abraham Morrison had 1380; Benjamin Burd 1311; Henry Wertz, junior 1309; Henry Wertz 556. It was the opinion of two of the judges, that the votes given to Henry Wertz, jun. and those for Henry Wertz, were intended to be for the same person, and therefore, in making out the return, did not declare which was chosen, but left it to the Senate to determine. (Beford Gazette)." The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA). October 26, 1805.

"PENNSYLVANIA ELECTION. Official Return. A List of the Senate...12th. District, Bedford, Huntingdon, and Somerset--contested between Abraham Morrison and Henry Wertz." United States' Gazette (Philadelphia, PA). November 4, 1805.

"District of Bedford, Huntingdon and Somerset: Abraham Morrison 1380; Henry Wertz, jun. 1369; Henry Wertz 556; Benjamin Burd 1311. The Senate voted 16 to 8 in favor of a report ~ "That Henry Wertz, Jun. is duly elected Senator for the District, composed of the Counties of Bedford, Huntingdon, and Somerset."" The Intelligencer, and Weekly Advertiser (Lancaster, PA). December 31, 1805.

sub_unit.name: Bedford
sub_unit.note: The results in Bedford County for Henry Wertz Jr., Abraham Morrison, and Benjamin Burd differ in each source. These county totals are taken from The Freeman's Journal, and Philadelphia Daily Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) which were published later than some others sources on October 26, 1805 and contain the most accurate results (which also match the totals for the district listed in the Original Election Returns). Early township totals were published in The Bedford Gazette (Bedford, PA) from October 19 and list Henry Wertz, Jr. with 579 votes, Abraham Morrison with 536 votes, and Benjamin Burd with 433 votes. The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) from October 19 lists Abraham Morrison with 555 votes.

sub_unit.name: Huntingdon
sub_unit.note: The Freeman's Journal, and Philadelphia Daily Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) list Henry Wertz, Jr. with 952 votes and Benjamin Burd with 776 votes. The Aurora. General Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) from October 28 also lists Benjamin Burd with 776 votes.

sub_unit.name: Somerset
sub_unit.note: The Freeman's Journal, and Philadelphia Daily Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) lists Benjamin Burd with 102 votes.
